dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1352 IH: To designate the General George C. Marshall House, in the Commonwealth of Virginia, as an affiliated area of the National Park System, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Subramanyam introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To designate the General George C. Marshall House, in the Commonwealth of Virginia, as an affiliated area of the National Park System, and for other purposes.

section.header: Establishment of the General George C. Marshall House as an affiliated area

subsection.text: The General George C. Marshall House, in the Commonwealth of Virginia, is established as an affiliated area of the National Park System.

The affiliated area shall consist of the area generally depicted as the General George C. Marshall House Property, Leesburg, Virginia on the map titled General George C. Marshall House, Proposed Affiliated Area, numbered 999/189,974, and dated September 2023.
The affiliated area shall be managed in a manner consistent with—

paragraph.text: any law generally applicable to units of the National Park System.

subsection.text: The George C. Marshall International Center shall be the management entity for the affiliated area.
The Secretary of the Interior (referred to in this section as the Secretary)—

paragraph.text: may provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the management entity for the purpose of providing financial assistance for the marketing, marking, interpretation, and preservation of the affiliated area; and

shall enter into an agreement with the management entity that delineates the roles and responsibilities for the management of the area consistent with the policies and standards that apply to units of the National Park System.

subsection.text: Nothing in this Act authorizes the Secretary to acquire property at the affiliated area or to assume managerial or financial responsibility for the operation, maintenance, or management of the affiliated area.
Nothing in this Act affects the land use rights of private property owners adjacent to the General George C. Marshall House.

paragraph.text: Nothing in this Act shall be construed to create buffer zones outside of the General George C. Marshall House.

paragraph.header: Activity or use outside the general george c. marshall house
paragraph.text: The fact that an activity or use can be seen, heard, or detected from within the George C. Marshall House shall not preclude, limit, control, regulate, or determine the conduct or management of activities or uses outside of the George C. Marshall House.
